article.title: Alypius_of_Antioch
article.paragraph: Alypius of Antiochwas ageographerand avicariusofRoman Britain, probably in the late 350s AD. He replacedFlavius Martinusafter that vicarius' suicide. His rule is recorded isAmmianusXXIII 1, 3.
article.heading: Life
article.paragraph: He came fromAntiochand served underConstantius IIand was probably appointed to ensure that nobody with western associations was serving in Britain during a time of mistrust, rebellion and suppression symbolised by the brutal acts of the imperial notaryPaulus Catena. He may have had to deal with the insurrection of the usurper namedCarausius II.

Alypius was afterwards commissioned to rebuild theTemple in Jerusalemas part ofJulian the ApostateJulian's systematic attempt to reverse theChristianizationof theRoman Empireby restoringPaganismpaganand, in this case,JudaismJewishpractices.Ammianus Marcellinus,Ammianus Marcellinus#WorkRes Gestae, XXIII.1.2Among the letters of Julian are two (29 and 30) addressed to Alypius; one inviting him toRome, the other thanking him for a geographical treatise, which no longer exists.sfnChisholm1911
